article.headline: South Florida 65, East Carolina 52
article.story: GREENVILLE, N.C. (AP) -- Melvin Buckley scored 20 points and hit four of his eight 3-point attempts to lead South Florida to a 65-52 win over East Carolina on Saturday. Solomon Bozeman added 16 points for the Bulls (6-1), and McHugh Mattis had 14 rebounds and nine points. Darrell Jenkins led the Pirates (4-4) with 16 points, and John Fields had 13 points and blocked seven shots. South Florida finished the first half with a 10-3 run and led 28-23 at the break. East Carolina shot just 29 percent from the floor in the first half. The Bulls took their largest lead of the game when consecutive 3-pointers by Bozeman and Buckley made it 43-32 with 12:44 left in the second half. East Carolina went on a seven-point run to climb back to within four midway through the second half, but consistent 3-point shooting kept the Bulls in the lead. South Florida was 5 for 7 from 3-point range in the second half, while the Pirates managed just 1 of 8 from 3-point range in the half.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
